revision.text:
{{distinguish|text=the animation producer who goes by [[Mr. Warburton]]}} {{BLP sources|date=December 2014}} {{Infobox person | birthname = Patrick John Warburton | image = Patrick Warburton by Gage Skidmore.jpg | image_size = | caption = Warburton at the 2010 [[San Diego Comic-Con International]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1964|11|14}} | birth_place = [[Paterson, New Jersey]], U.S. | home_town = [[Huntington Beach, California]], U.S. | occupation = Actor, voice artist | years_active = 1986–present | education = [[Servite High School]]
[[Newport Harbor High School]] | alma_mater = [[Orange Coast College]] | parents = John Charles Warburton Jr.
Barbara Jeanne Gratz (aka Barbara Lord) | spouse = {{marriage|Cathy Jennings|1991}} | children = 4 }} '''Patrick John Warburton''' (born November 14, 1964) is an American comedic actor and voice artist. In television, he is known for playing [[David Puddy]] on ''[[Seinfeld]]'',{{cite web|title=David Puddy|url=http://www.seinfeldonline.com/puddy.html|work=seinfeldonline.com|accessdate=December 30, 2010}} the [[Tick (comics)|title role]] on ''[[The Tick (2001 TV series)|The Tick]]'', Jeb Denton on ''[[Less Than Perfect]]'', Jeff Bingham on ''[[Rules of Engagement (TV series)|Rules of Engagement]]'', and [[Lemony Snicket]] on ''[[A Series of Unfortunate Events (TV series)|A Series of Unfortunate Events]]''.{{cite journal|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/patrick-warburton/169214|title=Patrick Warburton Bio and Photos|work=TV Guide|accessdate=May 27, 2010}} His voice roles include [[List of The Emperor's New Groove characters#Kronk|Kronk]] in ''[[The Emperor's New Groove]]'' and its sequels, Agent T in ''[[Men In Black 2]], [[Paraplegia|paraplegic]] police officer [[List of Family Guy characters#Joe Swanson|Joe Swanson]] on ''[[Family Guy]]'', [[List of The Venture Bros. characters#Brock Samson|Brock Samson]] on ''[[The Venture Bros]]'', Lok in the ''[[Tak and the Power of Juju]]'' video games and [[Tak and the Power of Juju (TV series)|television series]], Flynn in ''[[Skylanders]]''{{IMDb name|911320}} and Hugo Vasquez in ''[[Tales From the Borderlands]]''. In advertising, he has played a "control enthusiast" in a series of commercials for [[National Car Rental]].{{cite web|title=National Car Rental Control Enthusiast|url=https://www.nationalcar.com/en_US/car-rental/xp/control-enthusiast.html|accessdate=February 10, 2017}} ==Early life== Warburton was born in [[Paterson, New Jersey]],{{cite news|last=Yannis|first=Alex|url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9407E4D61239F93BA35753C1A963958260|title=HOCKEY;The Devils, And Fans, Ignite First Match|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=October 8, 1995|accessdate=November 25, 2007|quote=Moments after the banner was raised, Patrick Warburton, the actor who portrayed a fanatic Devils’ fan in a segment of the “Seinfeld” television show, was called upon to drop the puck. With his face painted in Devils red and black, the native of nearby Paterson dropped the puck, then stripped the Brodeur jersey he was wearing to display the letter D on his chest.}} the son of orthopedic surgeon John Charles Warburton Jr. and Barbara Jeanne Gratz (an actress credited as Barbara Lord).{{cite news|publisher=ESPN.com|work=ESPN.com|title=10 Burning Questions For..... Patrick Warburton|url=http://espn.go.com/page2/s/questions/warburton.html|accessdate=April 5, 2010}}{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1961/03/31/archives/gratz-warburton.html|work=The New York Times|title=Gratz – Warburton|date=March 31, 1961}}{{cite news|url=https://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0B10FC3C541B728DDDAD0894DE405B818AF1D3|work=The New York Times|title=Warburton — Gratz|date=June 4, 1961}} He and his three sisters, Mary, Lara, and Megan, were raised in a "very religious" and "conservative" Catholic family in [[Huntington Beach, California]],[http://articles.philly.com/1998-08-07/news/25724723_1_david-puddy-new-cartoon-series-seinfeld "Patrick Warburton Awaits A New Series Of Options"], Articles.philly.com (August 7, 1998); retrieved on July 25, 2012. where he attended Saints Simon and Jude Catholic School. He later attended [[Servite High School]] (in [[Anaheim, California]]), and later transferred to [[Newport Harbor High School]] (in [[Newport Beach, California]]). He studied [[marine biology]] at [[Orange Coast College]] in [[Costa Mesa, California]], but dropped out to pursue modeling and acting.{{cite web|url=http://www.moviefone.com/celebrity/patrick-warburton/1838008/biography|title=Patrick Warburton biodata|publisher=Movies.aol.com|date=November 14, 1964|accessdate=May 27, 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091004011051/http://www.moviefone.com/celebrity/patrick-warburton/1838008/biography|archivedate=October 4, 2009|df=}} ==Career== Warburton's acting roles often rely on his deep, booming voice and large physique. In the 1990s, he was known for his recurring role as [[David Puddy]] on ''[[Seinfeld]]'', the [[On-again, off-again relationship|on-again, off-again boyfriend]] of [[Elaine Benes]]. He had a small role in the 2002 film ''[[Men in Black II]]'' as J's new partner, T. Warburton starred in [[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX]]'s short-lived series ''[[The Tick (2001 TV series)|The Tick]]'', in which he held the [[Tick (comics)|title role]]. He has repeatedly criticized FOX's mismanagement of the series after its cancellation, stating that the network "apparently didn't have a clue."Bell, Josh [http://tvcomedies.about.com/od/interviews/a/warburtonqa_2.htm Patrick Warburton interview] About.com. Retrieved on 2-04-18. He played Nick Sharp in ''[[8 Simple Rules]]'' and joined the cast of ''[[Less Than Perfect]]'' in 2003, as anchorman Jeb Denton. He also played Jeff Bingham in ''[[Rules of Engagement (TV series)|Rules of Engagement]]'', and Rip Riley in the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] series ''[[Archer (TV series)|Archer]]''. [[File:PatrickWarburtonJan07.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Warburton in January 2007]] Warburton has put his voice to use for several animated films and TV programs, including a lead character in ''[[Game Over (TV series)|Game Over]]'', [[Buzz Lightyear]] and the Little Green Men in ''[[Buzz Lightyear of Star Command]]'', and [[List of The Emperor's New Groove characters#Kronk|Kronk]] in ''[[The Emperor's New Groove]]'', with [[David Spade]] and [[John Goodman]]; Spade and Warburton would reunite for the CBS sitcom ''[[Rules of Engagement (TV series)|Rules of Engagement]]'', which aired from 2007 to 2013, and ''[[Joe Dirt 2: Beautiful Loser]]'' in 2015. Warburton reprised his role as Kronk for the direct-to-video sequel, ''[[Kronk's New Groove]]'', and the subsequent TV series ''[[The Emperor's New School]]''. He voiced [[Steve Barkin]] in the [[Disney Channel]] show ''[[Kim Possible]]''. Warburton was also cast in ''[[The Venture Bros.]]'', in which he voices [[Brock Samson]]. He voices Joe Swanson on [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]]’s ''[[Family Guy]]'' and Detective Cash in ''[[The Batman (TV series)|The Batman]]''. He lent his voice talent to the [[Computer animation|computer-animated]] feature films ''[[Hoodwinked]]'', ''[[Chicken Little (2005 film)|Chicken Little]]'', ''[[Bee Movie]]'', ''[[Open Season (2006 film)|Open Season]]'', and ''[[Tak and the Power of Juju|Tak]]'' (all three games),''[[Tak and the Power of Juju (TV series)|Tak and the Power of Juju]].''{{citation needed|date=May 2014}} He was also the voice of Commander Blaine H. Tate on the Comedy Central animated series ''[[Moonbeam City]]'' in October 2015. Warburton appeared on [[Game Show Network|GSN]]’s ''[[Poker Royale]] Celebrities vs. the Pros'' tournament in 2005, winning the tournament and the $50,000 grand prize. On November 8, 2009, Warburton appeared as the wild west character Cal Johnson on ''Seth & Alex’s (Almost Live) Comedy Show'', hosted by [[Seth MacFarlane]] and [[Alex Borstein]], on Fox. He was also cast as the sheriff in the [[Cartoon Network]] series ''[[Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated]]''. He appeared as [[Bowser (character)|Bowser]] in a video by [[CollegeHumor]] entitled "The Roast of [[Mario]]".[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tPUgZlN6cdA&ob=av3e The Roast of Mario (featuring Patrick Warburton)]. YouTube (December 20, 2010). Retrieved on July 25, 2012. He appeared on the American version of ''[[Top Gear (U.S. TV series)|Top Gear]]'' on February 21, 2012. He set the “Big Star, Small Car” lap record, beating previous record-holder [[Arlene Tur]].[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/22/top-gear-patrick-warburton-angelina-jolie-car-video_n_1293171.html 'Top Gear': Patrick Warburton Named His 1969 Dodge Charger After Angelina Jolie (VIDEO)], Huffingtonpost.com, February 22, 2012; retrieved July 25, 2012. Warburton starred in the 2016 NBC sitcom ''[[Crowded (TV series)|Crowded]]'', in which he played alongside [[Carrie Preston]] as parents who are about to enjoy their empty nest years only to find their daughters and his parents are all moving back in to live with them. The show ran for one season of 13 episodes.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/05/crowded-canceled-nbc-one-season-1201755553/|title='Crowded’ Canceled By NBC After One Season|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|first=Nellie|last=Andreeva|date=May 13, 2016|accessdate=May 13, 2016}} He is featured in the "preboarding" video shown to guests at [[Soarin'|Soarin' Around the World]] in [[Disney California Adventure]] in [[Anaheim]], [[California]] and [[Epcot]] at the [[Walt Disney World Resort]], in [[Orlando, Florida]] where he explains the ride's requirements. He lent his voice to the droid G2-4T in the queue of [[Star Tours: The Adventures Continue]] at [[Disney's Hollywood Studios]] in Orlando, Florida and [[Disneyland]] in Anaheim, California. He currently plays Lemony Snicket in the series ''[[A Series of Unfortunate Events (TV series)|A Series of Unfortunate Events]]''. He appeared at a New Jersey Devils playoff hockey game on April 18, 2018 with his face (and chest) painted similar to that of his Devils crazed role in an episode of "Seinfeld", exhorting the crowd in a manner alike to that of his "Puddy" character. == Commercial voice-over == In the commercial and advertising world, Warburton is the voice in the [[Carrier Corporation]] commercials for their air-conditioning and HVAC units, and was the voice of [[Superman]] in ''[[The Adventures of Seinfeld and Superman]]'' for [[American Express]]. He is the voice of "Lewis" in the "Clark & Lewis Expedition" radio commercials for [[Horizon Air]]. In August 2009, Warburton played a high-end PC in a "[[Get a Mac]]" ad for [[Apple Inc]].[http://www.aoltv.com/2009/08/25/patrick-warburton-is-a-top-of-the-line-pc-in-the-latest-mac-ad/ Patrick Warburton is a 'top of the line' PC in the latest Mac ad]. Aoltv.com (August 26, 2009). Retrieved on July 25, 2012. Warburton became the spokesman for Japanese automaker [[Honda]]'s "Good Reasons" advertising campaign in September 2011.[http://eon.businesswire.com/news/eon/20110912006333/en/honda/honda-civic/honda-crv "New Ad Campaign Provides Plenty of 'Good Reasons' to Buy a New Honda"], eon.businesswire.com, September 12, 2011; retrieved July 25, 2012. He is the voice in NAPA's "Can of Know How" commercial. In 2015, Warburton became the star of [[National Car Rental]] commercials "Be the Boss of You". And he became the voice in the current "Discover Fresh" radio ad campaign by [[Souplantation]], a California-based buffet-style restaurant chain (the restaurant is known as "Sweet Tomatoes" in other markets).{{cite web|last1=Harper|first1=R.|title=Patrick Warburton is the New Voice of Souplantation and Fresh Produce is VERY Afraid|url=http://blog.souplantation.com/patrick-warburton-is-the-new-voice-of-souplantation-and-fresh-produce-is-very-afraid/#.VydplnErKUk|website=Souplantation|accessdate=2 May 2016|date=March 16, 2015}} Warburton is also the voice of Ranger, a forest ranger, in a series of radio spots for the national [[Smokey Bear]] campaign sponsored by the [[United States Forest Service|U.S. Forest Service]] and the [[Ad Council]].[http://audioarchives.oc.usda.gov/radnewsfeaturedetail.asp?ID=2468 USDA Radio News: Smokey Bear Updates Part of New Ad Campaign] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111015000104/http://audioarchives.oc.usda.gov/radnewsfeaturedetail.asp?ID=2468 |date=2011-10-15 }}. U.S. Dept of Agriculture. Retrieved on September 6, 2012. ==Personal life== Warburton married Cathy Jennings in 1991, and they have four children; [[Talon Warburton|Talon]], Alexandra, Shane and Gabriel.{{cite web|url=http://www.familycircle.com/teen/parenting/celebrity-parents/patrick-warburton-interview/|title=Celebrity Q+A: Patrick Warburton|publisher=familycircle.com|author=Patty Martinez|date=August 2012|accessdate=March 5, 2015}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role !
